name: Quantitative Economics with Python
tagline: John Stachurski and Thomas J. Sargent
body:
Quantitative Economics with Python is an on-line course on quantitative economic modeling using the Python programming language, authored by [John Stachurski](http://johnstachurski.net) and [Thomas J. Sargent](https://files.nyu.edu/ts43/public/).

The course consists of

* A [series of lectures](http://quant-econ.net)
* A [code repository](https://github.com/jstac/quant-econ) containing Python programs described in the lectures

### Getting Started

The [lecture series](http://quant-econ.net) provides information on getting starting with Python and working with [the code repository](https://github.com/jstac/quant-econ).  (If you wish you can go ahead and download a copy of the repository by clicking the 'Zip' button above.)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
